predicate.note: Frames file for 'thrash' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

role.descr: instrument, thing hit by or with

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Even more important, in our view, was the Treasury's threat *trace* to thrash the dollar.

example.name: agentive subject
example.text: Mary thrashed John with a series of stale marshmallows.

roleset.name: move violently and randomly

example.name: thrash around
example.text: ``They're thrashing around for diversification,'' he says.

roleset.note: This seems semi-phrasal, but the particle changes (around, about, etc).

example.name: just transitive
example.text: So far, neither the Bush administration nor arms-control experts in Congress seem moved by arguments that these problems may take more time *trace* *trace* to thrash *trace* out than President Bush has allowed.
